member.name: IRecordInfo.GetField
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the VARIANT containing the value of a given field name.
member.param: The instance of a record.
The field name.
The VARIANT that you want to hold the value of the field name, szFieldName. On return, places a copy of the field's value in the variant.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetFieldNames
member.summary: Gets the names of the fields of the record.
member.param: The number of names to return.

param.name: rgBstrNames
param.para: The name of the array of type BSTR.
If the rgBstrNames parameter is NULL, then pcNames is returned with the number of field names.

It the rgBstrNames parameter is not NULL, then the string names contained in rgBstrNames are returned. If the number of names in pcNames and rgBstrNames are not equal then the lesser number of the two is the number of returned field names. The caller needs to free the BSTRs inside the array returned in rgBstrNames.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetFieldNoCopy
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the value of a given field name without copying the value and allocating resources.
member.param: The instance of a record.
The name of the field.
The VARIANT that will contain the UDT upon return.
Receives the value of the field upon return.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetGuid
member.summary: Gets the GUID of the record type.
member.param: The class GUID of the TypeInfo that describes the UDT.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.
One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetName
member.summary: Gets the name of the record type. This is useful if you want to print out the type of the record, because each UDT has its own IRecordInfo.
member.param: The name.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.
The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetSize
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes of memory necessary to hold the record instance. This allows you to allocate memory for a record instance rather than calling RecordCreate.
member.param: The size of a record instance, in bytes.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.GetTypeInfo
member.summary: Retrieves the type information that describes a UDT or safearray of UDTs.
member.param: The information type of the record.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.
The state of the type library is not valid for this operation.

member.name: IRecordInfo.IsMatchingType
member.summary: Determines whether the record that is passed in matches that of the current record information.
member.param: The information of the record.

listheader.description: The record that is passed in matches the current record information.
The record that is passed in does not match the current record information.

member.name: IRecordInfo.PutField
member.summary: Puts a variant into a field.

param.name: wFlags
param.para: The only legal values for the wFlags parameter is INVOKE_PROPERTYPUT or INVOKE_PROPERTYPUTREF.
If INVOKE_PROPERTYPUTREF is passed in then PutField just assigns the value of the variant that is passed in to the field using normal coercion rules.

If INVOKE_PROPERTYPUT is passed in then specific rules apply. If the field is declared as a class that derives from IDispatch and the field's value is NULL then an error will be returned. If the field's value is not NULL then the variant will be passed to the default property supported by the object referenced by the field. If the field is not declared as a class derived from IDispatch then an error will be returned. If the field is declared as a variant of type VT_Dispatch then the default value of the object is assigned to the field. Otherwise, the variant's value is assigned to the field.

member.param: The pointer to an instance of the record.
The name of the field of the record.
The pointer to the variant.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.PutFieldNoCopy
member.summary: Passes ownership of the data to the assigned field by placing the actual data into the field.PutFieldNoCopy is useful for saving resources because it allows you to place your data directly into a record field. PutFieldNoCopy differs from PutField because it does not copy the data referenced by the variant.
member.param: The only legal values for the wFlags parameter is INVOKE_PROPERTYPUT or INVOKE_PROPERTYPUTREF.
An instance of the record described by IRecordInfo.
The name of the field of the record.
The variant to be put into the field.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordClear
member.summary: Releases object references and other values of a record without deallocating the record.
member.param: The record to be cleared.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordCopy
member.summary: Copies an existing record into the passed in buffer.
member.param: The current record instance.
The destination where the record will be copied.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordCreate
member.summary: Allocates memory for a new record, initializes the instance and returns a pointer to the record.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the created record.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordCreateCopy
member.summary: Creates a copy of an instance of a record to the specified location.
member.param: An instance of the record to be copied.
The new record with data copied from pvSource.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordDestroy
member.summary: Releases the resources and deallocates the memory of the record.
member.param: An instance of the record to be destroyed.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo.RecordInit
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a record.
member.param: An instance of a record.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more of the arguments is not valid.

member.name: IRecordInfo
member.summary: Describes the structure of a particular UDT. You can use IRecordInfo any time you need to access the description of UDTs contained in type libraries. IRecordInfo can be reused as needed; there can be many instances of the UDT for a single IRecordInfo pointer.
